title: Sovereignty and Its Limits
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sovereignty and Its Limits.

buildup.text: Sovereignty means a state has supreme authority within its territory, free from outside interference.

discovery.text: The Peace of Westphalia (1648) established sovereignty as the foundation of the international order.

twist.text: The Responsibility to Protect (R2P) says sovereignty isn't absoluteâ€”if a state fails its people, others may intervene.

climax.text: R2P was invoked in Libya (2011) but not in Syria. Its application remains deeply political.

punchline.text: Sovereignty is a shieldâ€”unless you use it to harm your own people.

quiz.question: What does the Responsibility to Protect (R2P) allow?
options: Intervention when a state fails to protect its people
